results.title: Sex
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), National AIDS Campaign and John Eastway
results.brief_description: Sex is a program for young people. It deals in a fast, funny and frank way with relationships, sex, sexuality and sexual health in the context of HIV/AIDS and other sexually transmitted diseases (STDs). Issues covered include choosing/negotiating not to have any sexual activity at all; choosing not to have penetrative sex; exploring alternative sexual activities; STDs, including HIV, their symptoms, modes of transmission and prevention; using condoms. Written by Morris Gleitzman of “Mother and Son” fame.

results.title: Sex
results.creator_credit: Martin Green, Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Growing awareness: Factors in plant production”.
If every plant of a species was identical, they could all be susceptible to devastation caused by environmental change. This program explains pollination, different methods of seed dispersal, and a detailed examination of meiosis. This ensures that plants swap genetic information randomly, so that the next generation is genetically unique. The retention of old varieties of plants, such as types of wheat, demonstrates the need to store a variety of genetic material.

results.title: Sewage solutions (advanced version)
results.creator_credit: Geoff Russell and Video Education Australia
results.brief_description: Deals with the mechanical, chemical and biological processes used to treat human sewage , looking at an inland system (Bendigo) and a marine based system (Geelong).
results.description: Deals with the mechanical, chemical and biological processes used to treat human sewage , looking at an inland system (Bendigo) and a marine based system (Geelong).

details.label: Subject categories
display_values: Communications, Infrastructure, & Transport → Sewage disposal plants

results.title: Sewage disposal
results.brief_description: The film opens with shots of the waste of a house flowing in the sewer, this sewer being illustrated by a remarkable cross-section of the waste disposal system of a house, and the sewer in the adjacent road. An animated map of London’s vast sewage system is built up historically, shown in relation to relief and drainage and the urban spread of London. Finally a close-up study of the pumping and purification station is shown, and we see the treatment of the seage until unusable sludge is shipped to sea.

results.title: Seventh rail report: speed the payload
results.brief_description: In many aspects of railway working, modern methods and structures are making for quicker results. Shows how sending loads of coal by the Merry-go-round trains is regularising the supply to the power stations, and how the Motorail terminal at Olympia speeds the holidaymaker comfortably on his way with his car. Also demonstrates British Rail’s hovercraft service between Southampton and Cowes in the Isle of Wight.

results.title: Seven wonders of the industrial world
results.creator_credit: Deborah Cadbury and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: This seven part television series is about seven wonders of civil engineering in the industrial age and ‘modern’ world. Man-made and magnificent, the series covers the creation of the biggest steam ship ever built, the Brooklyn Bridge, the Bell Rock Lighthouse, London’s sewerage system, the Panama Canal, the trans-American Railway and the Hoover Dam. Using actors in period costume and settings, and aided by computer animation techniques, this docu-drama style telling re-enacts the language and manners of the day to impart information in a really appealing way. The trials and controversies that occur when such huge constructions are undertaken - including the loss of life - are also covered. Narrated by Robert Lindsay.

results.title: Seven till five
results.creator_credit: Glasgow School of Art and Norman McLaren
results.brief_description: An impressionistic live-action study of art school activities from morning to night. This was the first film of the Glasgow School of Art Film Group. It won first prize in the Second Amateur Film Festival in Glasgow, 1934. This film has no dialogue or music effects. Photographed by W.J. Maclean.

results.title: Seven o'clock news
results.brief_description: Shows an ABC radio announcer preparing the script of the 7 o’clock news for transmission over the ABC network. A recruiting film illustrating many aspects of the work of the the PMG Department, including the provision of communications systems for radi broadcasting and the training of Post Office personnel as telegraphists, postal clerks and technicians.

results.title: Seven more stations
results.creator_credit: Patrick Henry, Academy Picture Corporation and Victor Sheridan
results.brief_description: A record of the opening of the Eastern Extension of London Transport’s Central line from Wanstead to Newbury Park, showing the planning, organisation and labour that went into the extension.

results.title: Seven days under Mavis
results.creator_credit: Michael Agar, Pig Hell Productions and Anna Johnson
results.brief_description: Based on real events, this short film explores the fate of Frank, an elderly man with a bad back, who is pinned beneath the body of his wife, Mavis, after she suddenly dies and collapses on top of him. For seven days in the heat of summer, Frank lies helpless. His back twisted in the fall, he finds his physical agony and despair turning to hatred of Mavis. He begins to hallucinate; past and present merge. Stripped of his physical strength, Frank is forced to search inside himself for the emotional resources which will save him.
